lines.gurmukhi: igAwn myG brKw srbqR brKY smwn aUco qj nIcY bl gvn kY jwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Giaan Maygh Barakhaa Sarabatr Barakhai Samaana , Oocho Taj Neechai Bal Gavan Kai Jaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as rain falls alike all over, and the water falling on higher ground flow down to lower ground automatically.

lines.gurmukhi: qIrQ prb jYsy jwq hY jgq cl jwqRw hyq dyq dwn Aiq ibgswq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Teerad Parab Jaisay Jaat Hai Jagat Chala , Jaatraa Hayt Dayt Daan Ati Bigasaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as on festivals people go to places of pilgrimage and feels happy making charities.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy niRp soBq hY bYiTE isMGwsn pY chUM Er qy drb Awv idn rwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Nrip Sobhat Hai Baitthiao Singhaasan Pai , Chahoon Aor Tay Darab Aav Din Raat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a king sits on throne and earns admirations, he receives gifts and offerings from all sides both during day and night.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy inhkwm Dwm swD hY sMswr ibKY Asn bsn cl Awvq jugwq hY ]629]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Nihakaam Dhaam Saadh Hai Sansaar Bikhai , Asan Basan Chal Aavat Jougaat Hai ?629?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the house of God-like True Guru is without desires. Like the rain water, charity at places of pilgrimage and the king, food items, clothes and money of Daswandh keep pouring in the house of the True Guru.
